cohort.reelThemIn: "In God we trust. All others, bring data." - W. Edwards Deming
cohort.bio: Whether it's determining how to incorporate the current inventory into a menu, or planning a menu based off student feedback, I've always enjoyed using critical thinking and analysis to solve problems. Through my experience at Nashville Software School, I've learned how to apply those same critical thinking skills to data analytics.

cohort.reelThemIn: "Any fool can make things complicated, it requires a genius to make things simple" ― E.F. Schumacher
cohort.bio: nan

cohort.reelThemIn: Connecting the dots between people and data
cohort.bio: Voracious curiosity compels me to study patterns and define paths. Learning Python and SQL at NSS has fueled my passion for defining data connections and organizing data for analysis and effective visuals to foster communication and understanding, making much more data accessible and actionable.

cohort.reelThemIn: "Every day I wake up is another chance to get it right"
cohort.bio: My data journey has led me to question everything, think outside the box and have fun!

cohort.reelThemIn: "People...operate with beliefs and biases. To the extent you can eliminate both and replace them with data, you gain a clear advantage." ― Michael Lewis
cohort.bio: When someone asks a question, I want to know more than just the answer. This inquisitiveness is what gave me a desire to learn the tools necessary to manipulate complex and varied data to generate meaningful conclusions for business decisions.

cohort.reelThemIn: "To overcome the insight deficit, Big Data-no matter how comprehensive or well analyzed-needs to be complemented by Big Judgment." - Shvetank Shah
cohort.bio: #NAME?

cohort.reelThemIn: "Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored." -Aldous Huxley
cohort.bio: I look forward to telling meaningful stories that will improve people's lives after a career telling stories as entertainment. Excited to apply step by step the technical, meticulous and thoughtful process required in film and video production to data analysis.

cohort.reelThemIn: "Making the simple complicated is commonplace; making the complicated simple, awesomely simple, that's creativity." - Charles Mingus
cohort.bio: A manager of creative teams and projects in Silicon Valley, New York City, and now Nashville. With an education in the analog world and experience in the digital world, my career has been one of creative solutions, transition with technology, and helping artists in the business of their creative endeavors.

cohort.reelThemIn: Ask not whether it can be done, but rather how we can accomplish it.
cohort.bio: Former litigator with a passion for interpreting data for process improvement and growth.

cohort.reelThemIn: "If the statistics are boring, you've got the wrong numbers." Edward Tufte
cohort.bio: I have always loved numbers and solving problems by using mathematical and stastical formula. Having spent the last several years leveraging my accounting degree by solving problems, I am excited to use my data analytics skills and tools.

cohort.reelThemIn: This is fine
cohort.bio: Proud Navy Veteran who relishes data-driven process improvements. Personal strengths include adaptability, consistency, and building consensus. Grateful to have traveled widely, completed a marathon, built a website, and learned a foreign language. Eager to learn and contribute.

cohort.reelThemIn: "Maybe stories are just data with a soul." ― Brené Brown
cohort.bio: I was driven to understand the why behind the data. The why is what motivated me to get into analytics. With my SQL background and my analytics skills, my goal is to provide future projections to companies when making key decisions.

cohort.reelThemIn: "If you can't explain it simply, you don't understand it well enough."-- Albert Einstein
cohort.bio: I am a person who loves finding the truth in things, and I love a good story. Telling the truth clearly so others can understand is exciting. For my entire life, I have been turning information into meaningful stories. It is a joy for me to dig the truth out of the details.

cohort.reelThemIn: There are two kinds of people in this world. 1: Those who can extrapolate from incomplete data.
cohort.bio: Something that I have always valued is the truth, however subjective it may be. Having the power to give people the truth with numbers is something that attracts me like a magnet. This school has given me the tools to do that.

cohort.reelThemIn: "Keep your eye on the doughnut, not on the hole." -David Lynch
cohort.bio: The world is full of useful information that must be organized and sorted in order to be properly understood. My new adventure as a data analyst allows me to combine my background in graphic design and web development with new tools to sift through complex datasets, determine correlations and present meaningful information to support good business decisions.

cohort.reelThemIn: "Never memorize something that you can look up." -Albert Einstein
cohort.bio: As an artist and illustrator I am fascinated by the ways we visually communicate. Whether it's the layout of a restaurant menu, or a Rembrandt painting, I love inspecting each element and connecting with the story behind the work. I am excited to connect with the story behind the data.

cohort.reelThemIn: Some people pronounce it "data", but I have always prefered pronouncing it "data"......
cohort.bio: I always thought story telling was done with a pen an paper, or a keyboard. Little did I realize it can also be done with SQL, and Python, and Tableau, and so many other tools that I have learned about in my time at NSS. I am now more equipped to tell so many more tales using data and I am forever grateful for that opportunity.

cohort.reelThemIn: "Everything simple is false. Everything which is complex is unusable." - Paul Valéry
cohort.bio: I thought that my data analytics journey started when a friend of mine told me he really valued his class at Nashville Software School. After taking the class myself I feel like analytics is something I've always been doing, after a fashion, and now I have more tools to do it quickly, accurately, and professionally.

cohort.reelThemIn: "All this happened, more or less" - Kurt Vonnegut
cohort.bio: nan

cohort.reelThemIn: "You can have data without information, but you cannot have information without data." - Daniel Keys Moran
cohort.bio: I have spent my professional career working with computer hardware. I creatively solve problems and maintain great customer experience. As I saw reporting for our company resulting in decisions being made, I knew I wanted to be a part of the reporting and analyzing data side. I am currently in Nashville Software School's Data Analytics Bootcamp and excited to bring meaning to data, asking great questions and visually representing answers.

cohort.reelThemIn: nan
cohort.bio: nan

cohort.reelThemIn: "It always seems impossible until it is done." - Nelson Mandela
cohort.bio: Carpenter turned data analyst, who has an infinity for puzzles. Data questions are like puzzles, puzzles that I can get paid to solve!

cohort.reelThemIn: I am ready to face any challenges that might be foolish enough to face me.
cohort.bio: nan
